value.title: From new Portuguese home, Ai Weiwei plans tribute to "visionary" Gorbachev
value.excerpt: Ai Weiwei, the Chinese dissident whose activist art has made him Beijing's best-known critic, has swapped life in British exile for Portugal, where, in a countryside estate east of Lisbon, he is working on a monument commemorating Mikhail Gorbachev.

value.title: Moscow metro facial ID payment system raises privacy concerns, rights group says
value.excerpt: A new facial recognition payment system on the Moscow metro, due to be launched this year, raises concerns about privacy and human rights, a Russian digital rights group said on Thursday.

value.title: Facebook trains A.I. to ‘see’ using 1 billion public Instagram photos
value.excerpt: Facebook has built an AI program called "SEER" that can tell what it is looking at. It did this by feeding it over 1 billion public images from Instagram.

value.title: Cables could help soft robots transform into harder structures
value.excerpt: The sub-category of soft robotics has transformed the way many think about the field. Oft-influenced by natural phenomenon, the technology offers a dramatically different approach than the sort of rigid structures we traditionally think of when we discuss robots.
